dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, B, have you seen the news about the Waltons this week? Pretty wild stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, B, have you seen the news about the Waltons this week? Pretty wild stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, A, yes! I mean, [interrupts] I saw that headline, like, "Waltons lose billions."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, A, yes! I mean, I saw that headline, like, Waltons lose billions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, billions with a B. We're talking a collective worth plummeting to, uh, nearly $156 billion after Thursday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, billions with a B. We're talking a collective worth plummeting to, uh, nearly one hundred fifty six billion dollars after Thursday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. And that was all because of Walmart's disastrous quarterly earnings report, right? The stock just tanked.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. And that was all because of Walmart's disastrous quarterly earnings report, right? The stock just tanked.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even in the era of e-commerce, Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Nearly 10% in, like, an hour and a half. I mean, that wiped out a cool $13 billion from their collective fortune just on that one day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Nearly ten percent in, like, an hour and a half. I mean, that wiped out a cool thirteen billion dollars from their collective fortune just on that one day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m. That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [Gasps softly] Wow. And I hear Alice Walton, Sam's only daughter, actually lost her title as the richest woman in the world?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And I hear Alice Walton, Sam's only daughter, actually lost her title as the richest woman in the world?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. Yep. She's now worth "only" $46 billion, which is still a lot, obviously, but she's behind L'Oréal heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. Yep. She's now worth only forty six billion dollars, which is still a lot, obviously, but she's behind L'Oréal heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She and her brothers Jim, 70 (net worth: $46.4 billion) and Rob, 73 ($46.2 billion), all rank among the nations top 20 richest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, like, the whole family, um, they're not even in the nation's top 20 richest anymore?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, like, the whole family, um, they're not even in the nation's top twenty richest anymore?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She and her brothers Jim, 70 (net worth: $46.4 billion) and Rob, 73 ($46.2 billion), all rank among the nations top 20 richest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: That's right. Her brothers, Jim and Rob, were also ousted. I think Jim's at $46.4 billion and Rob's just slightly behind him at $46.2 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right. Her brothers, Jim and Rob, were also ousted. I think Jim's at forty six point four billion dollars and Rob's just slightly behind him at forty six point two billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She and her brothers Jim, 70 (net worth: $46.4 billion) and Rob, 73 ($46.2 billion), all rank among the nations top 20 richest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Man. But what *caused* this disastrous report? What did Walmart say was going on?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man. But what caused this disastrous report? What did Walmart say was going on?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, this is the really confusing part, B. In their earnings announcement, Walmart actually, like, highlighted its dwindling online catalog and celebrated a decline in its grocery business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, this is the really confusing part, B. In their earnings announcement, Walmart actually, like, highlighted its dwindling online catalog and celebrated a decline in its grocery business.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, they *celebrated* that? Uh, how is a dwindling online presence and a shrinking grocery business a good thing? That makes no sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, they celebrated that? Uh, how is a dwindling online presence and a shrinking grocery business a good thing? That makes no sense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? They framed it as a "strategic victory" over Amazon. Apparently, Amazon abandoned Whole Foods a year ago to compete elsewhere, and Walmart sees this as them, like, winning that battle?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? They framed it as a strategic victory over Amazon. Apparently, Amazon abandoned Whole Foods a year ago to compete elsewhere, and Walmart sees this as them, like, winning that battle?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: That's... a very strange victory lap, if you ask me. Especially when you consider their grocery delivery service is now unavailable in 40% of America. And pickup's only at 1,800 locations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's... a very strange victory lap, if you ask me. Especially when you consider their grocery delivery service is now unavailable in forty percent of America. And pickup's only at eighteen hundred locations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a further financial blow, for sure. It's like they're, uh, deliberately shrinking their reach in some areas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a further financial blow, for sure. It's like they're, uh, deliberately shrinking their reach in some areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: So, if they keep going down this path, I mean, the article even estimates they could be the first family in history to dip below $200 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, if they keep going down this path, I mean, the article even estimates they could be the first family in history to dip below two hundred billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Walmart keeps this up, the Waltons may soon cross a threshold that absolutely no one else has. By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, still sounds like a lot, but it really speaks to the, uh, fleeting nature of even immense wealth and influence, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, still sounds like a lot, but it really speaks to the, uh, fleeting nature of even immense wealth and influence, doesn't it?
